title: Information Disclosure in /skills call

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Link: https://hackerone.com/settings/skills

IN respone of above request all reports submitted for review are getting disclosed.

activities.message: You guys recently launched new feature but on making above request, in response all the reports which are submitted for review are getting disclosed. PFA attached screenshot in original report.

If user will submit the application of Mobile, then he'd be able to see the submitted reports of that category only.So to see the particular category submitted issues,one have to apply for that.
Nice find @deepankerchawla, we're looking into this right now! We'll get back to you when we have an update.

Hi @deepankerchawla, we've identified the root cause of the problem and we're working on a fix. In the meantime, we've disabled the hacker skills feature. We'll reenabled it when the fix has been deployed to production. We expect the fix to go live soon. Thanks again, really nice find!
@deepankerchawla We deployed a fix and reenabled the feature. Can you test the fix? Thanks!
Thanks again, @deepankerchawla! We're in the process of doing some additional checks in our codebase and will follow up with you about our bounty decision soon.
Hi- I hope all additional checks have been implemented by now. So when should i expect bounty decision?
@deepankerchawla, sorry for the delay. You should be hearing back from us within the next day or so. Thanks for your patience!
@deepankerchawla, apologies for the overly long delay. Processing this now. Happy New Year!

@deepankerchawla -- thank you again for reporting to us.

We greatly appreciate your assistance in getting this issue quickly found and resolved.
We're sorry again for the long delay on bounty decision.

Happy hacking!

Thanks a lot @reed for doing this on holidays. Happy New Year to you, too!

You should redact this before disclosing: https://hackerone.com/reports/188719#activity-1344159

Thanks a lot @reed for doing this on holidays. Happy New Year to you, too!

You should redact this before disclosing: https://hackerone.com/reports/188719#activity-1344159
@michiel - Got your point, that's not how i usually report.Just wanted to report asap in this case. Thanks for bounty and wish you a very happy new year too!

summaries.content:
This issue was identified by @deepankerchawla on December 6th and resolved a few hours later. We would like to thank @deepankerchawla for bringing this to our attention and for working with us as we resolved the issue.

The new skill sets feature was released in stages to a limited set of hackers on the HackerOne platform. The issue was identified when about 20 users on HackerOne had access to the new feature, as the feature was on a paced roll out path. The skill set feature is used to send tailored invitations for private programs. Hackers have to submit reports as proof for their skills. Due to an incorrectly written query, the proof, which includes report titles, was exposed to all other hackers that applied for the same skill set. Noteworthy is that only report titles of fixed vulnerability reports could have been exposed and only the reports that were sent in as proof.

Our policy describes that HackerOne awards $10,000 for any vulnerability that might grant unauthorized access to confidential bug descriptions. Although HackerOne doesn’t believe this meets that exact description, HackerOne cannot guarantee what kind of information hackers provide in report titles. Because of that, we decided to still award a $10,000 bounty. However, anything other than the report title of resolved bugs were not exposed through this vulnerability.

user.name: Reed Loden
user.bio: The guy who does the thing. Security @ HackerOne.
